summary: This document appears to be a transcript of an interview or deposition of a corrections officer (MS. NOEL) regarding activities and procedures in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 9-10, 2019, the period surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The questioning focuses on staff rounds, access control, and whether any special instructions were given regarding Epstein.

persons.name: Ms. Noel
persons.context: Appears to be a corrections officer working in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center during the shift surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. She is being questioned about procedures, staff visits, and access control.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced indirectly as the subject of the investigation. The interviewer asks if any conversations were about him and if there were special instructions regarding him having a cellmate.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Mentioned briefly by the interviewer asking if Ms. Noel was told anything about 'Reyes' in relation to Epstein.

persons.name: Thomas
persons.context: Mentioned as a staff member who relieved another officer and went upstairs. Implied to be involved in the shift change and access procedures.

connections.description: Ms. Noel was a corrections officer working in the SHU where Epstein was held. She was responsible for access control and procedures in his unit.
Both were staff members at the correctional facility. Thomas relieved another officer and Ms. Noel likely coordinated access with him.

events.title: Shift change and rounds in SHU
events.description: Lieutenant Thomas came on duty around 5:30 a.m. Ms. Noel called him to discuss being relieved to get food. The questioning focuses on procedures and conversations during this shift.

events.title: Staff visit and rounds in SHU
events.description: An operations lieutenant visited the SHU at 4:00 to 'conduct a round.' Ms. Noel let her in and out, verified doors were shut and sealed, and confirmed she saw her the entire time.

locations: Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center
keyFacts: The interview focuses on procedures and staff activities in the SHU on August 9-10, 2019, the timeframe of Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Ms. Noel confirms she controlled access to the SHU, verifying doors were shut and sealed during authorized visits.
The interviewer probes whether any special instructions were given regarding Epstein, such as requiring him to have a cellmate, which Ms. Noel denies.
Multiple staff members (including an operations lieutenant and Thomas) are referenced in relation to shift changes and rounds, indicating a focus on chain of custody and access control.
